summary: Blue and Red is such a classic trope for a pairing,  what I like the most about Ironstrange is both Tony and Stephen could be...
body:
Blue and Red is such a classic trope for a pairing, what I like the most about Ironstrange is both Tony and Stephen could be blue and Red respectively.

Tony can be Red for his armor and Stephen Blue with his overall doctor strange outfit.

Tony Can also take the Blue role with his arc reactor and Stephen can take the Red one with his levitation cloak.

I stan one power couple.

blog.name: fandomsupporter
blog.title: Big Fan
blog.description: I am part of many fandoms (I mainly post mediocre Incorrect Marvel Quotes)

summary:
Peter: Controversial opinion. Bears don’t exist. 
Tony: *sips coffee*
Peter: What, nothing? 
Tony: Honestly, that’s the...
body:
Peter: Controversial opinion. Bears don’t exist. 
Tony: *sips coffee*
Peter: What, nothing? 
Tony: Honestly, that’s the closest thing to normal that I’ve heard from you all week.

dialogue.name: Tony
dialogue.label: Tony:
dialogue.phrase: Honestly, that’s the closest thing to normal that I’ve heard from you all week.

blog.description: Thanks for taking a look at my blog!  I'm 30 and have a BS in interior design and I live on a dairy farm.  You could say me and my blog are a little...eclectic. INFP-T

body:
Looking for a fic

So, I may be imagining things, but I swear at one point I read a fic where Tony still had the arc reactor in civil war, and when Bucky found out about it he got like real pissed at Steve and then drama, angst, and other fun things happen, then Bucky and Tony wind up together. Now I can’t find it.

title: Secrets are hard to keep
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2WSKYOn

by intern_at_german_chapterhouse

Peter is keeping a lot of secrets. The most important and well kept one being that he is New York’s favourite superhero Spider-Man. So clearly, everyone knows.

This story ties together Civil War, Spider-Man Homecoming and Infinity War.

blog.name: redspiderling
blog.title: Untangling the Widow's Web
blog.description: I use this blog to geek out about Natasha Romanoff, aka Black Widow. Lots meta analysis, all in regards to Natasha (some for the boys too, if I absolutely have to) as portrayed in the Marvel (and if we're lucky enough, somebody else in the future) comics and films.

tags: not related to black widow post
summary: Why Iron Man is the most likely character to die in Endgame
title: Why Iron Man is the most likely character to die in Endgame
body:
Read after the cut, Captain Marvel spoilers.

1) He was the one who practically initiated the MCU in 2008. We can see how he is being replaced with Captain Marvel, given that she even takes the place of the Original Avenger, by being the one who inspired Fury to create the entire project. The characters even have similar colour palettes. While the origin of their power is completely different, they have a similar arsenals (beam-like moves etc) as well as fighting tactics and movement.

2) It will provide the film with excellent dramatic effect. We would all expect Steve Rogers to give his life in service. We can see how Black Widow or Hawkeye would fall in a fight. But no one would expect a billionaire playboy, to offer his life in service of the many, except for this particular billionaire, Tony Stark. The man who started out as a weapons manufacturer who only cared about himself, and evolved into a superhero capable of giving up his life for others.

3) In terms of his relationship with Peter Parker, Iron Man’s death will work as an excellent stand-in for Uncle Ben, given how much Peter looks up to him.

4) Since they did have a very strong father-son relationship, it does work as a closure for the relationship he had with his father. Howard Stark was not a brilliant father figure, but Tony Stark can be. 

5) He might not have managed to have an actual child with Pepper, but if you don’t think Pepper will care for Peter Parker as if he were her own son you don’t know what you’re talking about.

These are all ways for Tony Stark’s arc to come to a closure, and why his death would hurt the most. Because he doesn’t have to die, he’s not a soldier, he wasn’t supposed to die, like e.g. Steve Rogers. But, as far as my humble opinion goes, he probably will.

by panna_acida

“Stephen?” Tony asked, looking at the man now gripping his hand. “Are you ok?” asked again after few second of silence, feeling the ice cold skin of the other man freeze his wrist, and the grip turning more strong by the second.

blog.name: bramblepatch
blog.title: Words Mean Things
blog.description:
Shannon, but you can call me Bramble. 28. They/them pronouns. Sometimes I get the morbs. Assorted fandoms. Lots of complaining about things I like. Strange ideas of what constitutes a cute animal.

Probably not actually a quagsire IRL. Avatar by tumblr user gamzee.

summary:
Early Iron Man suits in the MCU:
Fly
Shoot energy from hands
Armored against physical attacks
Dependent on thing giving Tony...
body:
Early Iron Man suits in the MCU:

  • Fly
  • Shoot energy from hands
  • Armored against physical attacks
  • Dependent on thing giving Tony radiation poisoning
  • Can kind of almost go to space

Conclusion: Fury’s first serious recruitment effort for the Avengers Initiative was a shitty knockoff of Carol.
